text: Marina Tucaković (; 4 November 1953 – 19 September 2021) was a Serbian songwriter. She wrote many hit albums and wrote over 4,000 songs. She wrote for Slađana Milošević, Oliver Mandić and Zana. Many of her songs were performed at the Eurovision Song Contest. She was born in Belgrade. In 2018, Tucaković was diagnosed with breast cancer. She died on 19 September 2021 from COVID-19 at a hospital in Belgrade, aged 67. ==References== Category:1953 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Serbian songwriters Category:Musicians from Belgrade Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Belgrade
title: Marina Tucaković
